content:
Do we have a night/master release of x86_64 with debug assertions and llvm assertions enabled that could be downloaded by rustup/RTIM by any chance?
Or is the only way of obtaining this building it myself? :upside_down:
does this also enable debug assertions inside dependencies that rustc uses? :sweat_smile:

There is a piece of rust code that triggers a panic inside rustc-rayon while building.. but only with the --alt bulder lol
https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-rayon/blob/rustc/rayon-core/src/worker_local.rs#L49
does this have parallel_compiler enabled by accident or something like that? :thinking:
the alt builds also enable parallel compiler, yeah
I'm not sure it's worth tracking ICEs in parallel compiler builds myself, this seems pretty clearly due to that.

ah ok. Yeah im mostly interested in the llvm/debug assertions :big_smile:
I'll see what i find with the --alt rust in 3-4 hours when its done crunching through all the files :)
